channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ukraine Invaded Russia. Here’s What It Was Like for Civilians.
item.description: Russians in the area of Ukraine’s invasion have described seeing signs of violent encounters, as well as respectful treatment from Ukrainian troops.

item.description: After a recent dam disaster, Nigerian officials blamed God, climate change and poor people. But experts had warned the dam was at risk well before it ...

item.title: Living on a Volcano’s Edge, Italians Practice for Disaster
item.description: The Italian authorities carried out a drill of their plan to save a half-million people from toxic fumes, deadly quakes or a full eruption. Vesuvius i...

item.title: Gelato Godfather: Inside the Sicilian ice cream empire built on mafia money
item.description: Over two-thirds of mafia infiltrations are in the construction, trade, real estate and manufacturing sectors.

item.title: The Curious Case of a Temple Sweet: How Food Increasingly Divides India
item.description: A Hindu politician has accused his Christian predecessor of allowing a temple’s sanctity to be violated with an animal product.

item.title: US approves sale of this advanced missile defense system to Taiwan in $2 billion arms package
item.description: The potential sales package includes three National Advanced Surface-to-Air Missile Systems (NASAMS) and related equipment.

item.title: AI is being used to send some households impacted by Helene and Milton $1,000 cash relief payments
item.description: The nonprofit GiveDirectly harnesses a Google-developed AI tool to pinpoint areas with high concentrations of poverty and storm damage.

item.title: Britcoin will not replace cash, BOE Governor Bailey says
item.description: Work has started on a digital version of the pound, dubbed Britcoin, but the BOE has yet to decide whether to launch one.

item.title: Michelle Obama Makes a Searing Appeal to Men: ‘Take Our Lives Seriously’

item.title: Trump, Harris tied with 49% each in new national Emerson poll
item.description: The latest poll shows a slight change from early October, when Harris had 50% support among likely voters compared with Trump’s 48%.

item.title: Israel’s Retaliatory Attack on Iran Appears Carefully Calibrated
